static MediaManager & GetInstance ()

Detailed Description

Central instance of the media framework. Allows to create and destroy media players and recorders which are used by the applications.
See also:
MediaController

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum MediaManager::MmfMsgType
 

Enumerator:
PauseApiCompletionMsg  Message that communicates the completion of Pause API to the app
PlayApiCompletionMsg  Message that communicates the completion of Play API to the app
RecordApiCompletionMsg  Message that communicates the completion of Record API to the app
RewindApiCompletionMsg  Message that communicates the completion of Rewind API to the app
FastForwardApiCompletionMsg  Message that communicates the completion of Rewind API to the app
StopApiCompletionMsg  Message that communicates the completion of Stop API to the app
InitCompletionMsg  Message that communicates the completion of Init to the app
UninitCompletionMsg  Message that communicates the completion of Deinit to the app
EofReachedMsg  Message that communicates the end of file to the app
CriticalErrorMsg  Message that communicates the critical to the app
NetworkMsgRtcpByeReceived  Message that communicates the reception of RTCP bye
MediaTypeNotSupportedMsg  Message that communicates the unsupportes media type
SamplingFrequencyNotSupportedMsg  Message that communicates the error unsupported frequency
NetworkErrConnErr  Message that communicates some network connection problem to the app
NetworkErrConnLostErr  Message that communicates some network connection lost to the app
NetworkErrUnknown  Message that communicates unknown network error to the app
NetworkErrConnectFailed  Message that communicates the connection attempt failure to the app
NetworkErrBandWidthTooHigh  Message that communicates that the media is of unsupported bandwidth
NetworkErrUrlNotFound  Message that communicates URL not found error to the app
NetworkErrUrlNotStreamable  Message that communicates that the url doesn't have hint tracks
NetworkErrSdpParseError  Message that communicates that SDP parsing failed
NetworkErrSdpFileOpenError  Message that communicates that SDP file opening failed
NetworkErrHTTPError  Message that communicates that HTTP error occurred
NetworkErrRtpDataError  Message that communicates that RTP data error occurred while streaming
NetworkErrUnknownServError  Message that communicates uncommon server errors to the app
NetworkErrCriticalError  Message that communicates critical network error to the app
BufferingStart  Message that communicates the start of buffering stage
BufferingComplete  Message that communicates the end of buffering stage
MediaInfoObtainedMsg  Message that communicates the completion of GetMedioInfo API
UnknownErrorMsg  Message that communicates any unknown error

enum MediaManager::MmfResult
 

Error-codes which can be retrieved by the output parameter error_code of the method MediaManager::CreateMediaPlayer and MediaManager::CreateMediaRecorder. It is also used as a parameter by the error message sent by the MediaFramework

Enumerator:
Success  function successfully completed
MediaTypeDifferent  MIME type passed to the MMF is different from the actual file MIME type (but supported by MMF)
MediaNotSupported  MIME type not supported by MMF.
OutOfMemory  Memory allocation failure.
SmallBuffer  The buffer passed by the application is insufficient for MMFr - Not Implemented.
NullParameter  The parameter passed To MMFr is NULL.
InvalidParameter  The parameter passed is invalid.
InvalidState  The MMF is not in a state to process a request -- Not Implemented.
FeatureNotSupported  The feature is not supported by MMF (e.g. due to HW constraints).
InvalidAudioTrack  The 3gpp file has an invalid audio track.
InvalidVideoTrack  The 3gpp file has an invalid video track.
FileNotFound  The file doesn't exist.
EmptyFile  The 3gpp file doesn't have any audio/video tracks.
Invalid3gppFile  The 3gpp file doesn't have any movie meta data.
Incomplete3gppFile  Not Implemented.
OpenFileFailure  The opening of the file failed for some reason.(e.g. fopen returned error).
InvalidMp3File  There is no sync frame in the Mp3 file.
CorruptMp3File  The Mp3 frame found is not valid.
VidResNotSupported  This video resolution is not supported.
AudSamplFreqNotSupported  This audio sampling frequency is not supported.
FpsNotSupported 
GeneralError  general or unknown error

Member Function Documentation

MediaPlayer* MediaManager::CreateMediaPlayer (  const char *  media_source,
MediaInfo &  media_info,
MimeType &  media_mime_type,
void *  mesg_dispatcher,
MmfResult &  result
) 
 

Returns a media player.

Parameters:
media_source [IN] Pointer to the media source filename.
media_info [OUT] Pointer to the result structure which contains information about all the media tracks in the source. The source may have zero or more video tracks and zero or more audio tracks.
mime_type [IN/OUT] MIME type of the source. If the MIME type passed to the function is invalid, the Framework shall change this argument value to the actual MIME type.
result If video file open is successful, MmfMediaTypeDifferent if the passed MIME type is not valid (but the opening is successful), MmfMediaNotSupported if the MIME type is not supported by the MMF, otherwise MmfGeneralError.
Returns:
Pointer to the media player. 0 is returned, if no media player could be created. If the media player is not needed anymore, it must be destroyed by invoking MediaManager::DestroyMediaPlayer.

MediaPlayer* MediaManager::CreateMediaPlayer (  const BinData *  media_source,
MediaInfo &  media_info,
MimeType &  media_mime_type,
void *  mesg_dispatcher,
MmfResult &  result
) 
 

Returns a media context for the media data which should be rendered.

Parameters:
media_source [IN] Reference to the media source.
media_info [OUT] Pointer to the result structure which contains information about all the media tracks in the source. The source may have zero or more video tracks and zero or more audio tracks.
mime_type [IN/OUT] MIME type of the source. If the MIME type passed to the function is invalid, the Framework shall change this argument value to the actual MIME type.
result If video file open is successful, MmfMediaTypeDifferent if the passed MIME type is not valid (but the opening is successful), MmfMediaNotSupported if the MIME type is not supported by the MMF, otherwise MmfGeneralError.
Returns:
Pointer to the media player. 0 is returned, if no media player could be created. If the media player is not needed anymore, it must be destroyed by invoking MediaManager::DestroyMediaPlayer.

MediaRecorder* MediaManager::CreateMediaRecorder (  void *  mesg_dispatcher,
MmfResult &  mmf_result
) 
 

Returns a media recorder.

Parameters:
result Output parameter which contains the error code if the creating of the media context has been failed.
Returns:
Pointer to the media recorder. 0 is returned, if no media recorder could be created. If the media recorder is not needed anymore, it must be destroyed by invoking MediaManager::DestroyMediaRecorder.

void MediaManager::DestroyMediaPlayer (  MediaPlayer *  media_player  ) 
 

Destroys the media player created by MediaManager::CreateMediaPlayer. This method should be invoked as soon as the media player is not needed anymore to allow other media players to access the media resources.

void MediaManager::DestroyMediaRecorder (  MediaRecorder *  media_recorder  ) 
 

Destroys the media controller created by MediaManager::CreateMediaRecorder. This method should be invoked as soon as the media recorder is not needed anymore to allow other media recorders to access the media resources.

const MediaFrameworkCaps* MediaManager::GetCapabilities (   )  const
 

Returns the MediaFramework capablities.

Returns:
A pointer to a class containing the framework capabilities; In case of failure a NULL pointer.

MediaManager & MediaManager::GetInstance (   )  [static]
 

Returns a static instance of the MediaManager.

Returns:
Reference to the media manager.
